The Greene County Veterans Council takes great pleasure in congratulating Isaac Abram, the recipient of our 2020 Memorial Scholarship!
A small ceremony was conducted on June 9th, 2020, and was attended by the Abram Family and a small group of Council members. Opening remarks were given by Veterans Council Commander Bob Sipes and the Scholarship Certificate was presented to Mr. Abram by County Veterans Service Officer (CVSO), Richard Nichols. The event was hosted by Open Arms HEBRON Home in Lyons. The
$1000 Scholarship is awarded to a Greene County High School Senior and is based upon applications to our annual essay contest. The Veterans Council would like to thank all of the applicants, screeners, judges, Open Arms HEBRON Home Staff, and CVSO Staff member Rhonda Dowden for coordinating the Scholarship process. Well done, Isaac, and many thanks to the Abram Family for attending our event!
Congratulations to Isaac Abram for this honor.
